trans-unit.source: Get Started with authentication in Mobile Services for Xamarin Android apps | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Get Started with authentication in Mobile Services for Xamarin Android apps | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Mobile Services to authenticate users of your Xamarin Android app through a variety of identity providers, including Google, Facebook, Twitter, and Microsoft.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Mobile Services to authenticate users of your Xamarin Android app through a variety of identity providers, including Google, Facebook, Twitter, and Microsoft.

trans-unit.source: Get started with authentication in Mobile Services
trans-unit.target: Get started with authentication in Mobile Services

trans-unit.source: This topic shows you how to authenticate users in Azure Mobile Services from your app.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows you how to authenticate users in Azure Mobile Services from your app.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you add authentication to the quickstart project using an identity provider that is supported by Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you add authentication to the quickstart project using an identity provider that is supported by Mobile Services.

trans-unit.source: After being successfully authenticated and authorized by Mobile Services, the user ID value is displayed.
trans-unit.target: After being successfully authenticated and authorized by Mobile Services, the user ID value is displayed.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial walks you through these basic steps to enable authentication in your app:
trans-unit.target: This tutorial walks you through these basic steps to enable authentication in your app:

trans-unit.source: [Register your app for authentication and configure Mobile Services]
trans-unit.target: [Register your app for authentication and configure Mobile Services]

trans-unit.source: [Restrict table permissions to authenticated users]
trans-unit.target: [Restrict table permissions to authenticated users]

trans-unit.source: [Add authentication to the app]
trans-unit.target: [Add authentication to the app]

trans-unit.source: This tutorial is based on the Mobile Services quickstart.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial is based on the Mobile Services quickstart.

trans-unit.source: You must also first complete the tutorial [Get started with Mobile Services].
trans-unit.target: You must also first complete the tutorial [Get started with Mobile Services].

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Register your app for authentication and configure Mobile Services
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Register your app for authentication and configure Mobile Services

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Restrict permissions to authenticated users
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Restrict permissions to authenticated users

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio or Xamarin Studio, run the client project on a device or simulator. Verify that an unhandled exception with a status code of 401 (Unauthorized) is raised after the app starts.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio or Xamarin Studio, run the client project on a device or simulator. Verify that an unhandled exception with a status code of 401 (Unauthorized) is raised after the app starts.

trans-unit.source: This happens because the app attempts to access Mobile Services as an unauthenticated user, but the
trans-unit.target: This happens because the app attempts to access Mobile Services as an unauthenticated user, but the

trans-unit.source: TodoItem
trans-unit.target: TodoItem

trans-unit.source: table now requires authentication.
trans-unit.target: table now requires authentication.

trans-unit.source: Next, you will update the app to authenticate users before requesting resources from the mobile service.
trans-unit.target: Next, you will update the app to authenticate users before requesting resources from the mobile service.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Add authentication to the app
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Add authentication to the app

trans-unit.source: Add the following property to the TodoActivity class:
trans-unit.target: Add the following property to the TodoActivity class:

trans-unit.source: Add the following method to the TodoActivity class:
trans-unit.target: Add the following method to the TodoActivity class:

trans-unit.source: This creates a new method to handle the authentication process.
trans-unit.target: This creates a new method to handle the authentication process.

trans-unit.source: The user is authenticated by using a Facebook login.
trans-unit.target: The user is authenticated by using a Facebook login.

trans-unit.source: A dialog is displayed which displays the ID of the authenticated user.
trans-unit.target: A dialog is displayed which displays the ID of the authenticated user.

trans-unit.source: If you are using an identity provider other than a Facebook, change the value passed to LoginAsync above to one of the following: MicrosoftAccount, Twitter, Google, or WindowsAzureActiveDirectory.
trans-unit.target: If you are using an identity provider other than a Facebook, change the value passed to LoginAsync above to one of the following: MicrosoftAccount, Twitter, Google, or WindowsAzureActiveDirectory.

trans-unit.source: In the OnCreate method, add the following line of code after the code that instantiates the MobileServiceClient object.
trans-unit.target: In the OnCreate method, add the following line of code after the code that instantiates the MobileServiceClient object.

trans-unit.source: This call starts the authentication process and awaits it asynchronously.
trans-unit.target: This call starts the authentication process and awaits it asynchronously.

trans-unit.source: From the Run menu, then click Run to start the app and sign in with your chosen identity provider.
trans-unit.target: From the Run menu, then click Run to start the app and sign in with your chosen identity provider.

trans-unit.source: When you are successfully logged-in, the app should run without errors, and you should be able to query Mobile Services and make updates to data.
trans-unit.target: When you are successfully logged-in, the app should run without errors, and you should be able to query Mobile Services and make updates to data.
